body: Would need a way to support `monospace` as a font family on macOS. I'm not sure of a good way to do that.

issue.title: unrecoverable error on startup: couldn't find monospace font
issue.body:
Here is the output when starting the editor:

```
Alexs-MacBook-Air-3:alacritty alex$ target/release/alacritty
device_pixel_ratio: 1
device_pixel_ratio: 1
width: 1024, height: 768
Initializing glyph cache
Alacritty encountered an unrecoverable error:

	Couldn't find a font with name 'monospace' and style 'slant=Normal, weight=Normal'
```

A blank window briefly flashes on the screen but disappears.

OSX 10.9.5

body:
How about an array of font fallback options?

```yaml
font:
  - &a
    family: monospace
    # optional keys: style, bold.family, bold.style, italic.family, italic.style
    size: 11.0
    offset: { x: 2.0, y: -7.0 }
  -
    <<: *a # pulls in any un-repeated keys (e.g. size) from above
    family: Menlo
    offset: { x: 1.0, y: -1.0 }
```
Not sure, but I think https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/957 would address this, since we could just list `Menlo` as the first fallback font?

issue.title: Default behaviour of config file
issue.body:
This is not an issue but rather a question to better understand the default behaviour of the config file.

Is it necessary to have all the keybindings configured in the config file (as they are stated in the default config files), or can I remove them and only keep the ones that I have changed?

What I mean is that, does Alacritty have default hardcoded keybindings for different platforms like Linux and macOS which work in the same way as other configuration options.
For example the boolean configuration options need to be only specified in the config file, if the user needs to set them to `true`, the default value of `false` is implied and in that case the option can be removed from the config file. I am assuming this is the default behavior?

Another example would be the `selection.semantic_escape_chars`, can it be removed from the config file if the user has not changed it?

issue.title: Alacritty prints scancodes instead of copy-paste on macos
Make all options optional with fallback to defaults
issue.body:
I am making a module for configuring alacritty using Nix.
It is pretty tedious to make an option for each and every configuration option available in alacritty, especially the ones that most users may never touch.
Would it be possible to make all options optional, such that they fallback to the default values provided in https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/master/alacritty.yml ?
This makes it possible for the user to make a minimal configuration, thus it is easy to see what you have actually changed, and what is still default.
This is the module I am speaking of: https://github.com/rycee/home-manager/pull/500
